author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Everything is on the line' in filling Ginsburg vacancy
description: Cecile Richards, Alicia Garza and Katherine Grainger, co-founders of the women's activism group, Supermajority, join MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez on American Voices to discuss what is at risk in the decision to fill the open Supreme Court seat.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘Justice Ginsburg would’ve said don’t be angry, get to work and take action’: Beto O'Rourke on the legacy of late Justice
description:
As early voting begins, the death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is injecting fresh turmoil into the final stretch of President Trump and Joe Biden’s 2020 campaigns.
MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez sits down with former Texas Democratic Congressman and former 2020 De…
source.name: MSNBC

title: 'Healthcare is at risk': The impact of Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s death on everyday Americans
description: In the wake of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s death, MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez speaks with Ria Tabacco Mar, the Director of the ACLU Women's Rights Project, Laura Packard, the founder of Health Care Voter and a stage 4 cancer survivor, and Juan Escalante,
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Worried about the future of the Supreme Court? Ruth Bader Ginsburg wasn’t.
description: Several years before her death, the iconic Supreme Court Justice explained why ideological shifts on the nation’s highest Court don’t always turn out the way anyone expected.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Michael Steele: 'Stop treating Donald Trump as if he is a legitimate president'
description: Former RNC Chairman, Michael Steele, Joins AMJoy to discuss the Democrats strategy for next 45 days and calling the period after the election before the inauguration an "exercise of war gaming." He tells the panel to stop treating Donald Trump as if he is a "…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: GOP seeking RBG's seat, healthcare repeal analyzed by Stabenow
description: Senate Republicans seeking the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s seat, plus the repeal of Obamacare, and more are analyzed by Sen. Debbie Stabenow (D-MI). Stabenow tells Jonathan Capehart, ‘Our power comes from all of us speaking out, and then …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘Notorious RBG’ co-author on SCOTUS's dark history and potential
description: The Supreme Court has a dark history that late former Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg helped to counter in her written dissents and more. Irin Carmon, co-author of ‘Notorious RBG,’ joins Jonathan Capehart to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Kenosha, WI voters discuss systemic racism: ‘Until you actually experience it, you can’t fathom it’
description: Voters in Kenosha, Wisconsin discuss racial inequality and the police shooting of Jacob Blake with MSNBC’s Ali Velshi on the second stop of his “Velshi Across America 2020” tour, which will cover eight swing states before the election.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘No proposals’ from Senate Democrats to expand the Supreme Court, says Sen. Dick Durbin
description: Democratic Sen. Dick Durbin of Illinois says Senate Democrats are hoping four Republicans will side with them over the “rank hypocrisy” of voting on Trump’s Supreme Court nominee before the election.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Colorado Attorney General recalls clerking for RBG: ‘I had a front row seat to a true trailblazer’
description: Colorado Attorney General Phil Weiser, Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s former clerk and the last person to argue a case before her on the Supreme Court, shares his memories of working with RBG on United States v. Virginia and Romer v. Evans.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Kathleen Sebelius on Supreme Court vacancy: ‘The entire Affordable Care Act is at stake’
description: Former Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius says millions of Americans will lose their healthcare if a conservative-led Supreme Court overturns the Affordable Care Act after a planned November case hearing.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: On SCOTUS ‘all Democrats can do is plan retaliation’ expert says
description: Republicans replacing the late Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg with a Donald Trump nominee during the final days of his term could be met with retaliation, as one of the only tools Democrats have without a majority in the Senate. Axios political rep…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Murkowski won’t support SCOTUS vote before election
description: Republican Sen. Lisa Murkowski released a statement expressing her opposition to replacing Justice Ginsburg before the November election. She is the second Republican senator to oppose a pre-election vote.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NBC/WSJ poll: Biden leads by 8 points nationally
description: A new NBC/WSJ poll shows Joe Biden with an 8 point lead nationally over President Trump.  This lead comes from Biden dominating Trump when it comes to both Black and women voters, NBC’s Garrett Haake reports.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Mourner outside Supreme Court: Justice Ginsburg was 'champion for women and equality'
description: Mourners gathered outside of the U.S. Supreme Court to honor the life and legacy of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Many spoke about Ginsburg’s legacy and said, “She was a huge champion for women and equality.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Missouri Bikefest attendee: If I was worried about Covid-19 'I would have stayed home'
description: Thousands of motorcycle enthusiasts gathered in Lake of the Ozarks in central Missouri for an annual Bikefest at a time when the state is seeing a rise in coronavirus cases. One attendee said, “If I was worried about getting sick I would have stayed home.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Politics expert: SCOTUS change could ‘take us back to the ‘50s’
description: The anticipated Supreme Court battle in the Senate could impact key legal precedents if Donald Trump is allowed to nominate a new justice in the final days of his term. Jonathan Capehart and SiriusXM radio host Joe Madison discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 63% of Americans support Roe v. Wade as fears grow of overruling
description: Roe v. Wade’s possible fate in the Supreme Court is analyzed by legal expert Maya Wiley, University Professor at The New School. Sixty-three percent of Americans support Roe v. Wade as fears grow of the Supreme Court overruling this historic decision.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Politics experts debate Democrats’ next moves in 2020 fight
description: Speaker Nancy Pelosi and more Democrats are praised for their grit in the 2020 fight, while some question how voters will become more motivated to participate in the coming elections. Jonathan Capehart and his panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump accused of allegedly eroding trust in U.S. institutions
description: Donald Trump’s statements on the CDC, recent protests, and more have been called autocratic by experts, who warn that the president’s behaviors in their view align with signs indicating that a nation’s democracy is eroding. Jonathan Capehart and his panel dis…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Supreme Court now ‘kitchen table issue’ for Dems journalist says
description: The Supreme Court is now a ‘kitchen table issue’ for Democrats along with issues such as combating racism, journalist Errin Haines says. Democratic organization Act Blue raising $100 million in the wake of the death of Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsbur…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Schumer, AOC talk high stakes of Supreme Court vacancy
description: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez spoke at Ruth Bader Ginsburg’s high school in Brooklyn, N.Y., following her death. The two stressed the importance of waiting until after the 2020 presidential election to name Ginsburg’s …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Tip of the iceberg': alleged forced hysterectomies on ICE detainees spurs conversation on America’s history with sterilization
description: MSNBC’s American Voices with Alicia Menendez brings in her panel - Lindsay Toczylowski, the Executive Director of the Immigrant Defenders Law Center, Caitlin Dickerson, National Immigration Reporter for The New York Times and Julissa Arce, the author of “My (…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Gotcha: Trump truth-tellers will 'drown' the president with damaging information
description: Rev. Al Sharpton exhibits a myriad of books written by authors who were once close to Donald Trump. The authors share a common theme - exposing the truth about the president.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'The path to an electoral victory goes through the Latino vote'
description: New polling from NBC News, the Wall Street Journal, and Telemundo reveals that Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden is leading with Latino voters nationally. However, it’s a different story for Latino voters in key swing states. MSNBC’s Alicia Menendez s…
source.name: MSNBC

title: DNC Chairman Tom Perez on how Dems will respond if Trump’s SCOTUS is rammed through
description: In the wake of Justice Ginsburg’s death, Democratic National Committee Chairman, Tom Perez joins Alicia Menendez on American Voices to discuss President Trump’s promise to force a vote on her successor, and how the Democrats might respond. Chairman Perez
source.name: MSNBC
